column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref

#Text=[0047] Furthermore, while the examples of linear and two-dimensional barcodes have been described above, those of skill in the art will understand that other methods of encoding the configuration parameters may also be used.

#Text=The RD system according to the present invention may be used with any encoding method wherein the network appliance has the ability to read the encoded configuration parameters and configure itself for operation on the network.
#Text=[0048] As described above, the configuration information may be encoded on an RFID tag and read by an RFID reader of the network appliance.
#Text=Thus, in this case, the RD system would include a device for encoding an RFID tag rather than a printer to print barcodes, e.g., printer 45 of network 1 may be replaced with a RFID tag encoder.
#Text=[0049] FIG. 7 shows an exemplary process 200 for the WS 40 operation of the RD system.
#Text=This process 200 may either be outsourced to a third party or executed internally by the owner of the wireless network.
#Text=For example, the third party may be the vendor of the device such that the barcodes may be included in the box with the device.
#Text=Throughout this description, it will be considered that the system administrator will be operating the WS 40.
#Text=Initially, the RD Tool is launched on the WS 40 in step 205.
#Text=In step 215, the system administrator selects the provisioning mode for the RD system.
#Text=In step 220, the RD Tool determines the selected provisioning mode.
#Text=In mode 1, all the provisioning information is stored in the generated barcode.
#Text=Thus, in step 225, the system administrator enters all the provisioning information into the RD profile and this information will be encoded into the barcode when it is generated.
#Text=All the provisioning information is self-contained in the barcodes.
#Text=[0050] However, if the system administrator selects mode 2 provisioning, the barcode will contain information as to where the network appliance may obtain the desired provisioning packages.
#Text=A special barcode is generated in step 230 containing password information for accessing provisioning packages from a network server.
#Text=The barcode may also contain additional information such as the name of the host server, the path for the package, the transfer protocol, etc.
#Text=[0051] In a next step 235 of provisioning mode 2, the provisioning package is created and secured by a password.
#Text=As described above, a provisioning package may include a series of applications and services that is to be deployed on the network appliance.
#Text=This package of applications and services may be stored on a network server (e.g., network server 25).
#Text=The RD tool may be used to create this package on the network server.
#Text=In step 240, the provisioning package is deployed to the provisioning network server.
